results.title: Mr Ikegami's flight
results.brief_description: Mr Ikegami is in Sydney on business. Back in Tokyo, his wife Seisuko is expecting their first child. A tale of divided loyalties. Features Kazuhiro Muroyama as Mr Ikegami. Japanese/English with English subtitles. Original format 35 mm

results.title: Odd jobs
results.creator_credit: Daniel Nettheim, Jonathon Green, AFTRS and Andrew Ryan
results.brief_description: Two Boy Scouts, intent on earning money by doing odd jobs, stumble upon a spooky old house and its macabre owner. He looks forward to scaring them with his “house of horrors” - but young boys today aren’t so easily frightened.

results.title: Universal Appliance Co.
results.creator_credit: Andrew Lancaster, Ruth Kleinhenz, AFTRS and Michaeley O'Brien
results.brief_description: 1. An inventor finally gets a chance to mass produce his latest creation at the Universal Appliance Company factory. The production line runs smoothly until advertising and romance become distractions. Another multi-award winning production for director and sound designer Andrew Lancaster.

results.title: Distinguished guests
results.creator_credit: Louise Meek, Loretta Fisher, AFTRS and P.J. Hogan
results.brief_description: Christopher (Colin Friels) is sure he really likes psychology - but not the way it is taught at his university. Professor Wiseman, his tutor, is a disciple of the eminent European pyschologist, Professor Eisenbach - a cold rational behaviourist whose books are always cited as authorities. As a joke, Christopher and his girlfriend decide that he will impersonate Eisenbach and teach Professor Wiseman a lesson. Co-written by PJ Hogan (Muriel’s Wedding). Also features Tracy Mann.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Louise Meek, Loretta Fisher, AFTRS and P.J. Hogan

results.title: It's a living
results.creator_credit: Laurie Kirkwood, AFTRS and David Poltorak

results.title: Letters from Poland: Sydney, November, 1950
results.brief_description:
In Sydney in 1950 a young Polish woman waits for the arrival of Tadek, her prospective husband. Working as a night cleaner in a city office, she strikes up a casual friendship with the nightwatchman and waits for Tadek.
Cast features Martin Vaughan. Photography and editing by Martha Ansara.
